summary: Completed comprehensive testing of Clerk authentication integration for LinkedIn Authority Engine. All authentication requirements are working perfectly - unauthenticated API requests properly return 401 errors, Clerk sign-in/sign-up pages load correctly with proper branding and functionality, and API versioning is correct.
passed_tests: API root endpoint returns version 4.0.0 correctly
Backend health check working via API root endpoint
Unauthenticated /api/posts returns 401 'Authentication required'
Unauthenticated /api/settings returns 401 'Authentication required'
All protected endpoints (/api/auth/me, /api/posts, /api/knowledge, /api/voice-profiles, /api/analytics/performance) correctly return 401 without authentication
Public endpoints (/api/, /api/validate-hook) remain accessible without authentication
Clerk sign-in page loads correctly at root URL with proper redirect
Sign-up link is visible and functional on sign-in page
Sign-in form displays email input field correctly
Sign-in form displays Continue button correctly
Email input field is functional and accepts input
Continue button is clickable and properly enabled
LinkedIn Authority Engine branding is present on both sign-in and sign-up pages
App description 'Create high-quality, authority-building LinkedIn content' is visible
Clerk security branding 'Secured by Clerk' is present
Social login options (Google and LinkedIn) are available
Sign-up page loads correctly with proper form elements
Sign-up page has all required fields (First name, Last name, Username, Email, Password)
Navigation between sign-in and sign-up pages works correctly
Terms of Service and Privacy Policy links are present
Development mode indicator is visible (appropriate for test environment)
